revised_title: The Development and Origin of Liver Macrophages: Lymphocyte and Bone-Marrow Precursors
tldr: The authors studied the development of liver macrophages and found that they can be derived from two different precursors: lymphocytes and bone-marrow cells. The type of precursor depends on the nature of the reticulo-endothelial stimulus. This research provides insight into the origin and life-history of macrophages and their role in the immune system.
